info.title: JIRA
info.description: JIRA is a software development tool for agile teams to plan, track, and release world-class software. Connecting JIRA issues to the rest of your tools helps break down barriers and unleash the potential of your team.

put.description: Edits an issue. A transition may be applied and issue properties updated as part of the edit.

parameters.name: issueIdOrKey
parameters.description: Provide the Issue ID or Key for the issue you wish to edit

parameters.name: notifyUsers
parameters.description: Do you want to notify users?

parameters.name: overrideScreenSecurity
parameters.description: Do you want to override the screen security?

parameters.name: overrideEditableFlag
parameters.description: Do you want to override the editable flag?

activityDescriptionKey.description: History meta data activity description key

emailDescriptionKey.description: History meta data email description key

key.description: Key

201.description: Returned if the request is successful.

204.description: Returned if the request is successful.

400.description: Returned if the request body is missing. The user does not have the necessary permission to edit one or more fields. The request includes one or more fields that are not found or are not associated with the issue's edit screen. The request includes an invalid transition.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

403.description: Returned if the user uses `overrideScreenSecurity` or `overrideEditableFlag` but doesn't have the necessary permission.

404.description: Returned if the issue is not found or the user does not have permission to view it.

delete.description: Deletes a project. Permissions required: Administer Jira (global permissions)

parameters.name: projectIdOrKey
parameters.description: The project ID or project key (case sensitive).

parameters.name: enableUndo
parameters.description: Whether this project is placed in the Jira recycle bin where it will be available for restoration.

204.description: Returned if the project is deleted.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

404.description: Returned if the project is not found or the user does not have permission to delete it.

put.description: Updates the project details of a project.

parameters.name: projectIdOrKey
parameters.description: Provide the project ID or Key you want to update1

key.description: Key

200.description: Returned if the project is updated.

400.description: Returned if the request is not valid.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

403.description:
Returned if:

 *  the user does not have the necessary permission to update project details.
 *  the permission scheme is being changed and the Jira instance is Jira Core Free or Jira Software Free. Permission schemes cannot be changed on free plans.

404.description: Returned if the project is not found.

200.description: Returned if the request is successful.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

post.description: Creates a project category. Permissions required: Administer Jira (global permissions)

201.description: Returned if the request is successful.

400.description:
Returned if:

 *  `name` is not provided or exceeds 255 characters.
 *  `description` is not provided or exceeds 1000 characters.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

403.description: Returned if the user does not have the necessary permission.

409.description: Returned if the project category name is in use.

delete.description: Deletes a project category. Permissions required: Administer Jira (global permissions)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project category to delete.

204.description: Returned if the request is successful.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

403.description: Returned if the user does not have the necessary permission.

404.description: Returned if the project category is not found.

get.description: Returns the status of a long-running asynchronous task. When a task has finished, this operation returns the JSON blob applicable to the task.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The ID of the task.

200.description: Returned if the request is successful.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

403.description: Returned if the user does not have the necessary permission.

404.description: Returned if the task is not found.

post.description: Cancels a task. Permissions required: either of: Administer Jira or Creator of the task.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The ID of the task.

parameters.name: X-Atlassian-Token
parameters.description: The X-Atlassian-Token nocheck requirement

201.description: Returned if the request is successful.

202.description: Returned if the request is successful.

400.description: Returned if cancellation of the task is not possible.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

403.description: Returned if the user does not have the necessary permission.

404.description: Returned if the task is not found.

get.description: Returns a user. Permissions required: Browse users and groups.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, *5b10ac8d82e05b22cc7d4ef5*. Required.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Use expand to include additional information about users in the response. This parameter accepts a comma-separated list. Expand options include: *  `groups` includes all groups and nested groups to which the user belongs. *  `applicationRoles` includes details of all the applications to which the user has access.

200.description: Returned if the request is successful.

401.description: Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing.

403.description: Returned if the calling user does not have the browse users and groups global permission.

404.description: Returned if the Account ID is missing.

key.description: Key

post.description: This operation is used to create a new issue.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Pick a project to create the issue in.

post.description: This operation is used to create a new issue.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Pick a project to create the issue in.

parameters.name: issueTypeIds
parameters.description: Pick an issue type.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Item

get.description: This operation is used to retrieve the issue object for a given issue Key.

parameters.name: issueKey
parameters.description: Unique Key of the issue.

put.description: This operation is used to update an existing JIRA issue.

parameters.name: issueKey
parameters.description: Unique Key of the issue.

post.description: This operation is used to add a comment to an existing JIRA issue.

parameters.name: issueKey
parameters.description: Unique Key of the issue to add a comment to.

get.description: This operation is used to retrieve a list of issue types for a given project.
This operation is used to retrieve a list of fields for a specific issue type.
This operation is used to retrieve a list of projects for your JIRA instance.

post.description: This operation is used to create a new JIRA project.

key.description: The unique key, starts with a capital letter.

get.description: This operation is used to retrieve a list of projects for your JIRA instance.
This operation is used to retrieve a list of statuses for a project and issue type.
This operation is used to retrieve a list of all users associated with a project.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Unique key of the project.

get.description: This operation returns a list of the users who can be assigned issues for a given project.
This operation returns a list of priority types.

get.summary: When a new issue is created
get.description: This operation triggers when a new issue is added to the given project.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Unique key of the project to look for new issues.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create an issue.

get.description: This operation triggers when an existing issue is closed in the given project.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Unique key of the project to look for new issues.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, close an issue.

get.description: This operation triggers when an existing JIRA issue is updated.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Unique key of the project to look for updated issues.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, update an issue.

get.summary: When a new issue is returned by a JQL query
get.description: This operation triggers when a new issue appears in the latest 100 results of a JQL query.

parameters.name: jql
parameters.description: Query to use.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create an issue that matches the JQL query.

self.description: Browse to the issue using this URL.

id.description: Unique id of the issue type.

description.description: Verbose title of the issue type.

iconUrl.description: Icon associated with the issue type.

timespent.description: The time spent on an issue

id.description: The unique id of the project.

key.description: The unique key of the project.

projectTypeKey.description: Unique key of the project type.

aggregatetimespent.description: The aggregate time spent on sub-tasks.

resolution.description: Type of resolution the issue has achieved.

workratio.description: The percentage of work logged vs the issue estimate.

iconUrl.description: Icon associated with the issue priority.

timeestimate.description: Time remaining estimated time in seconds.

aggregatetimeoriginalestimate.description: The original sum of all sub-task time estimates in seconds.

accountId.description: Person a issue is assigned to.

key.description: User key of the person issue is assigned to.

emailAddress.description: Email of the person issue is assigned to.

displayName.description: Display name of the person issue is assigned to.

key.description: Issue status category.

timeoriginalestimate.description: The original time estimate in seconds.

aggregatetimeestimate.description: Time sum of all sub-tasks remaining estimated time in seconds.

components.description: A system field that is multiple values addressed by 'name' (e.g. Active Directory, Network Switch).

key.description: Unique key of the user who created the issue.

emailAddress.description: Email of the user who created the issue.

displayName.description: Name of the user who created the issue.

key.description: Unique key of the user who reported the issue.

emailAddress.description: Email of the user who reported the issue.

displayName.description: Display name of the user who reported the issue.

progress.description: The total progress completed of all sub-tasks in seconds.

total.description: The total sum of all estimated sub-task effort.

percent.description: The percent of aggregate completed progress in relation to estimated effort.
The percent of completed progress in relation to estimated effort.

customfield_10119.description: Epic name is required for epic issue type. This field matches 'customfield_10011' field on JIRA server.

emailAddress.description: Email of the person who created the issue.

tags.name: Issues
tags.description: This resource represents Jira issues. Use it to edit issues.

tags.name: Issue attachments
tags.description: This resource represents issue attachments and the attachment settings for Jira. Use it to add an attachment.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: This resource represents projects. Use this resource to update and delete projects.

tags.name: Project categories
tags.description: This resource represents project categories. Use it to create, and delete project categories as well as obtain a list of all project categories.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description: This resource represents a [long-running asynchronous tasks](#async-operations). Use it to obtain details about the progress of a long-running task or cancel a long-running task.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: This resource represent users. Use this resource to get a User.
